definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: The spring water is of dark green, deep and running all the year round.
sentences.chinese: 泉水碧绿凝重，深不见底，终年涌流不息。

sentences.english: The grid shimmers with " current" or grid flux.
sentences.chinese: 网格以“涌流”或网格流动变化轻轻震颤着。

sentences.english: If challenges are too low, one gets back to flow by increasing them.
sentences.chinese: 如果挑战太容易，我们可以增加挑战以回到涌流。

sentences.english: Surge irrigation is a new kind of water saving technique for surface irrigation.
sentences.chinese: 涌流灌溉是一种节水型地面灌溉新技术。

sentences.english: How often do people experience flow?
sentences.chinese: 人们经历涌流的频率如何？

sentences.english: You can hear the blood rushing through your head.
sentences.chinese: 你可以听到血液在头部涌流的声音。

sentences.english: It is the fresh of the deep spring of life.
sentences.chinese: 青春是生命深泉在涌流。

sentences.english: These exceptional moments are what I have called "flow" experiences.
sentences.chinese: 这些非同寻常的时机就是我所谓的“涌流”经历。

sentences.english: Where rivers of delight shall ever roll.
sentences.chinese: 喜乐河滚滚，涌流何久常。

sentences.english: The primary causes forming low-latitude arid region are cold ocean current and upwelling current.
sentences.chinese: 低纬旱区的成因主要是冷洋流和上涌流。

sentences.english: It is the full involvement of flow, rather than happiness, that makes for excellence in life.
sentences.chinese: 完全投入到涌流而非幸福之中，让生活卓越。

sentences.english: It is the freshneof the deep spring of life.
sentences.chinese: 罠青春是生命的深泉在涌流。

definition: to well up/to spill out (of water from a spring)
to flow at great speed/to pour/racing current
to gush/to squirt/to surge/to well out/to overflow
copious/plentiful (of water)/surging (of waves)/refers to home village of first Han emperor 漢高祖|汉高祖[Han4 Gao1 zu3]/fig. majestic
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to be full to overflowing/to be brimming over with
